title: The p-dispersion Model for Facility Dispersion Problem
description: In some facility location problems, facilities need to be positioned so that the influence of one doesnâ€™t overshadow or adversely affect the others. Suppose the distances (or some other dispersion metric) between two locations are computed in advance. The p-dispersion problem must define the location of p facilities among a set of discrete nodes to maximize the minimum distance between all pairs of selected nodes.

parameter.name: p
parameter.description: the number of facilities to be selected

variable.name: x
variable.description: the value of 1 if a location `i` is selected and 0 otherwise

variable.name: D
variable.description: the minimum distance between all pairs of selected nodes

variable.name: z
variable.description: the binary variable that indicates both nodes `i` and `j` are selected

objective.name: MaxMinimumDistance
objective.description: the minimum distance between all pairs of selected nodes

constraint.name: define the minimum distance between all pairs of selected nodes
constraint.description: define the minimum distance between all pairs of selected nodes
